snippet: Ruling in a decade-long dispute between a gay man and the Boy Scouts of America, a judge here has held that the Constitution gives the organization the right to bar the man from becoming a scoutmaster.   In issuing her decision on Tuesday, the jud...
lead_paragraph: Ruling in a decade-long dispute between a gay man and the Boy Scouts of America, a judge here has held that the Constitution gives the organization the right to bar the man from becoming a scoutmaster. In issuing her decision on Tuesday, the judge, Sally G. Disco of Superior Court, said that requiring the Scouts to accept the man would interfere with their freedom as a private organization to tell their members that homosexuality is wrong.

headline.main: Judge Rules Scouts Can Block Gay Man As a Troop Leader
